DSA Notes

Pehli baar seekh rahe ho? Perfect! ðŸ’ª Hinglish mein samjho â€” Easy se Advanced tak! ðŸš€

? all shortcuts  |  Ctrl + K search  |  T theme
ðŸŽ“

Pehli Baar DSA Seekh Rahe Ho? Yahan Se Shuru Karo!

Sabse pehle basics samajh lo â€” phir problems easy lagenge! ðŸ’ª

ðŸ¤”

DSA Kya Hai?

Data Structures = Data ko organize karne ke tarike

Jaise ghar mein almirah, drawer, shelf hoti hai â€” code mein Array, HashMap, Set hote hain!


Algorithms = Problems solve karne ke steps

Jaise recipe follow karte ho â€” same steps, same result! ðŸ³

ðŸŽ¯

DSA Kyun Seekhein?

  • âœ… Interviews â€” Google, Amazon, Microsoft sab DSA poochte hain
  • âœ… Problem Solving â€” Dimag sharp hota hai
  • âœ… Better Code â€” Fast aur efficient programs likhoge
  • âœ… Confidence â€” Koi bhi problem solve kar paoge!
ðŸ“¦

Basic Data Structures â€” Pehle Yeh Samjho!

ðŸ“‹ Array

Ek line mein rakhe hue boxes â€” har box ka number (index) hota hai

[10, 20, 30, 40]

Index 0 se start hota hai! arr[0] = 10

ðŸ—ºï¸ HashMap / Dictionary

Key-Value pairs â€” jaise phone book (naam â†’ number)

{"apple": 5, "banana": 3}

Key se directly value mil jaati hai â€” O(1) time!

ðŸŽ¯ Set

Sirf unique items â€” duplicates allowed nahi

{1, 2, 3} (no repeats!)

Check karna fast hai â€” "Yeh item hai ya nahi?"

ðŸ“ String

Characters ki array â€” words aur sentences

"hello" = ['h','e','l','l','o']

Immutable hoti hai (change nahi hoti)

â±ï¸

Time Complexity â€” Big O Notation (BAHUT Important!)

Yeh batata hai ki code kitna fast ya slow hai. Jitna chhota O, utna better!

O(1) Constant â€” Instant! âš¡ HashMap se value nikalna
O(log n) Logarithmic â€” Bahut Fast Binary Search
O(n) Linear â€” Theek hai Array mein ek baar loop
O(n log n) Log Linear â€” Sorting Merge Sort, Quick Sort
O(nÂ²) Quadratic â€” Slow! ðŸ¢ Nested loops (loop ke andar loop)
O(2â¿) Exponential â€” Bahut Slow! ðŸ’€ Recursion without memoization
ðŸ’¡ Yaad rakho: Interview mein hamesha poochte hain "Time Complexity kya hai?" â€” Toh har solution ka Big O zaroor samjho!
ðŸ’¡

Learning Tips

  • ðŸ“– Pehle samjho, phir likho â€” Copy-paste se kuch nahi hoga
  • âœï¸ Khud se code karo â€” Paper pe bhi try karo
  • ðŸ” Revise karo â€” 2-3 din baad wapas solve karo
  • ðŸŽ¯ Easy se shuru karo â€” Direct hard problems mat karo
  • â° Daily 1-2 problems â€” Consistency > Quantity
ðŸ–¥ï¸

Yeh Page Kaise Use Karein?

  • âŒ¨ï¸ ? dabao â€” Saare shortcuts dikhenge
  • ðŸ” Ctrl+K â€” Search karo koi bhi problem
  • âœ… Double-click â€” Problem complete mark karo
  • â­ B dabao â€” Bookmark karo
  • ðŸŒ™ T dabao â€” Dark/Light theme toggle
  • ðŸ“‹ Code pe hover karo â€” Copy button dikhega

Ready ho? Chalo pehle problem se shuru karte hain! ðŸš€

ðŸ“š Problem #1

Contains Duplicate

Array mein duplicate elements dhundne ke 4 tarike â€” simple se optimized tak! ðŸ”

ðŸŸ¢ Easy Level

Problem Kya Hai?

Ek integer array nums diya gaya hai. Tumhe batana hai ki array mein koi duplicate value hai ya nahi. Agar koi bhi value ek se zyada baar aati hai, toh true return karo, warna false.

ðŸŽ¯ Example: [1, 2, 3, 1] â†’ true (kyunki 1 do baar aa raha hai)
ðŸŽ¯ Example: [1, 2, 3, 4] â†’ false (sab unique hain)

ðŸŽ­ Real-life Analogy â€” Samjho Asaan Bhasha Mein!

Scenario: Socho tumhare paas ek box of marbles hai aur har marble pe ek number likha hai. Tumhe batana hai ki koi bhi number do marbles pe repeat ho raha hai ya nahi? ðŸ”µðŸ”´ðŸŸ¢

Method 1 (Brute Force): Ek-ek marble uthao, baaki sab marbles se compare karo â€” "Yeh wali aur wo wali same toh nahi?" Time lagega bohot! ðŸ˜…

Method 2 (Sorting): Saari marbles ko number wise line mein lagao â€” same number wali automatically paas paas aa jayengi! ðŸ“Š

Method 3 (HashSet): Ek register maintain karo. Jab bhi marble dekho, register mein check karo â€” "Yeh number pehle likha hai kya?" Agar haan, duplicate mil gaya! Agar nahi, register mein likh do. âœï¸

ðŸ’¡ Real Interview Insight: Interviewer actually ye dekhna chahta hai ki tum trade-off samajhte ho ya nahi â€” Time vs Space. HashSet fast hai but extra memory lagti hai. Sorting mein memory nahi lagti but original array change ho jata hai. Dono options discuss karo interview mein!

ðŸŽ¤ Interview Tips â€” Interviewer Ko Impress Karo!

  • â“ Pehle clarifying questions poochho: "Kya array mein negative numbers ho sakte hain?" "Kya array sorted hai?" "Array kitna bada ho sakta hai?"
  • ðŸ“ Brute force se shuru karo: "Sabse simple approach nested loops hai..." â€” Ye dikhata hai ki tum problem samajh gaye ho
  • ðŸš€ Phir optimize karo: "Isko improve karne ke liye, hum HashSet use kar sakte hain..." â€” Ye dikhata hai ki tum better solutions soch sakte ho
  • âš–ï¸ Trade-offs discuss karo: "HashSet O(n) time deta hai but O(n) extra space bhi leta hai. Agar space constraint ho toh sorting better hai"
  • ðŸ”„ Edge cases mention karo: Empty array, single element array, all same elements, all unique elements

â“ Common Follow-up Questions â€” Ye Bhi Pooch Sakte Hain!

Q1: "Agar duplicates ki count return karni ho toh?"
â†’ HashMap use karo jo frequency store kare, phir count nikalo jo >1 hain

Q2: "Agar exactly k duplicates allowed hon toh?" (Contains Duplicate II)
â†’ HashMap mein index store karo, check karo ki same value ke beech ka gap â‰¤ k hai ya nahi

Q3: "Agar constant space mein karna ho aur array modify nahi kar sakte?"
â†’ Floyd's Cycle Detection use karo (advanced technique)

Q4: "Agar array bohot bada ho aur memory mein fit na ho?"
â†’ External sorting ya Bloom Filter consider karo (ye advanced hai, but mention karna good impression deta hai)

1

Brute Force Approach

Intuition (Sochne Ka Tarika)

Sabse simple aur seedha tarika â€” har ek element ko baaki saare elements ke saath compare kar lo! ðŸ”

Matlab agar array mein 5 elements hain, toh pehle element ko baaki 4 se compare karo, phir doosre ko baaki 3 se, aur aisa hi chalte jao. Agar kabhi bhi do same values mil gayi, toh duplicate mil gaya!

ðŸ’­ Socho jaise class mein sabke birthdays check kar rahe ho â€” har student ko har doosre student se poochna padega!

Algorithm (Steps)

  1. Do nested loops lagao â€” outer loop i ke liye, inner loop j ke liye
  2. Inner loop i + 1 se start karo (khud se compare mat karo!)
  3. Agar nums[i] == nums[j] toh turant true return karo
  4. Saari pairs check hone ke baad koi match nahi mila? false return karo
Python 
class Solution:
    def hasDuplicate(self, nums: List[int]) -> bool:
        for i in range(len(nums)):
            for j in range(i + 1, len(nums)):
                if nums[i] == nums[j]:
                    return True
        return False

Time & Space Complexity

â±ï¸ Time Complexity
O(nÂ²)
ðŸ’¾ Space Complexity
O(1)
ðŸ˜… Slow hai bhai! n elements ke liye nÃ—n comparisons â€” 1000 elements = 10 lakh operations!
2

Sorting Approach

Intuition (Sochne Ka Tarika)

Agar array ko sort kar dein, toh jo bhi duplicate elements honge, wo ek doosre ke paas aa jayenge! ðŸ“Š

Phir bas ek simple loop lagao aur har element ko uske pichle wale se compare karo. Agar dono same hain = duplicate found! âœ…

ðŸ’­ Jaise students ko height ke hisaab se line mein khada karo â€” same height wale automatically paas paas aa jayenge!

Algorithm (Steps)

  1. Array ko sort karo (chhote se bade)
  2. Index 1 se loop start karo (0 se nahi, kyunki pehle element ka previous nahi hota)
  3. Har element ko uske previous element se compare karo
  4. Agar dono equal hain â†’ true return karo
  5. Loop khatam ho gaya bina match ke? â†’ false
Python 
class Solution:
    def hasDuplicate(self, nums: List[int]) -> bool:
        nums.sort()  # Array ko sort kar do
        for i in range(1, len(nums)):
            if nums[i] == nums[i - 1]:
                return True
        return False

Time & Space Complexity

â±ï¸ Time Complexity
O(n log n)
ðŸ’¾ Space Complexity
O(1)
ðŸ¤” Better than brute force! Sorting mein n log n lagta hai, jo nÂ² se kaafi better hai.
3

Hash Set Approach

Intuition (Sochne Ka Tarika)

Hash Set ek aisi data structure hai jo sirf unique values store karti hai, aur kisi bhi value ko O(1) time mein dhundh sakti hai! ðŸ”¥

Idea simple hai: Ek empty set lo. Array mein ghoomte jao â€” agar current number pehle se set mein hai, toh duplicate mil gaya! Warna use set mein daal do.

ðŸ’­ Socho jaise ek register maintain kar rahe ho â€” har naya naam aane pe pehle check karo kahin pehle se toh nahi likha!

Algorithm (Steps)

  1. Ek empty set banao (seen = set())
  2. Array ke har number pe loop lagao
  3. Check karo: kya ye number pehle se set mein hai?
  4. Agar hai â†’ true return (duplicate mila!)
  5. Nahi hai â†’ set mein add kar do
  6. Loop khatam, koi duplicate nahi â†’ false
Python 
class Solution:
    def hasDuplicate(self, nums: List[int]) -> bool:
        seen = set()  # Empty set banao
        for num in nums:
            if num in seen:  # Pehle dekha hai?
                return True
            seen.add(num)  # Set mein daal do
        return False

Time & Space Complexity

â±ï¸ Time Complexity
O(n)
ðŸ’¾ Space Complexity
O(n)
ðŸš€ Best time complexity! Har element ko sirf ek baar dekhte hain.

ðŸ§  Kyun Ye Approach Kaam Karta Hai? â€” Deep Understanding!

HashSet ki superpower hai ki wo O(1) time mein bata deta hai ki koi element usmein hai ya nahi! Ye internally hashing use karta hai.

Hashing ka logic: Har number ko ek "address" milta hai (hash function se). Jab check karte ho "5 hai kya?", toh seedha us address pe jaake dekh lete ho â€” poori list scan nahi karni padti! ðŸ 

Real-world example: Socho library mein books dhundhni hai. Brute force = har shelf check karo. HashSet = catalog dekho, seedha shelf number milo, wahan jao! ðŸ“š

âš¡ Pro Tip: Python mein set() aur dict dono internally hash table use karte hain. Isliye in operator O(1) hai set/dict mein, but O(n) hai list mein!

ðŸ“‹ Step-by-Step Dry Run â€” Ek-Ek Step Samjho!

Input: nums = [1, 2, 3, 1]

Stepnumseen (Set)num in seen?Action
Start - {} (empty) - Initialize empty set
1 1 {} âŒ No Add 1 â†’ {1}
2 2 {1} âŒ No Add 2 â†’ {1, 2}
3 3 {1, 2} âŒ No Add 3 â†’ {1, 2, 3}
4 1 {1, 2, 3} âœ… YES! ðŸŽ‰ Return True
ðŸ‘† Dekho step 4 mein 1 dobara aaya â€” set mein pehle se tha â€” duplicate found! Loop pura complete hone ki zaroorat nahi, jaise hi duplicate mila, return kar diya!
4

Hash Set Length (One-Liner) ðŸŽ¯

Intuition (Sochne Ka Tarika)

Ye previous approach ka shortcut version hai! Set automatically duplicates remove kar deta hai.

Toh agar original array ki length set ki length se zyada hai, iska matlab kuch elements remove ho gaye â€” yani duplicates the! ðŸ§ 

ðŸ’­ Jaise 10 students ki class mein agar unique roll numbers 8 hi nikle, toh 2 duplicates zaroor hain!
Python 
class Solution:
    def hasDuplicate(self, nums: List[int]) -> bool:
        return len(set(nums)) < len(nums)

Time & Space Complexity

â±ï¸ Time Complexity
O(n)
ðŸ’¾ Space Complexity
O(n)
âœ¨ Cleanest code! Ek line mein kaam ho gaya. Interview mein impress karne ke liye perfect!
âš ï¸

Common Galtiyan (Pitfalls)

Galat Comparison in Brute Force

Nested loops mein sabse common mistake â€” inner loop ko i se start karna instead of i + 1. Isse element khud se compare ho jata hai!

Python âŒ Wrong 
for j in range(len(nums)):
    if nums[i] == nums[j]:
        return True
Python âœ… Correct 
for j in range(i + 1, len(nums)):
    if nums[i] == nums[j]:
        return True

Original Array Modify Karna

Sorting approach mein nums.sort() use karne se original array badal jata hai!

Python âš ï¸ Risky 
nums.sort()
Python âœ… Safe 
sorted_nums = sorted(nums)

ðŸ“‹ Quick Comparison Table

Approach Time Space Notes
Brute Force O(nÂ²) O(1) Slow but simple
Sorting O(n log n) O(1)* Better, modifies array
Hash Set O(n) O(n) Fast! Extra space
Set Length BEST O(n) O(n) Clean one-liner! âœ¨
ðŸ“š Problem #2

Valid Anagram

Do strings anagram hain ya nahi â€” 3 alag tarike se check karo! ðŸ”¤âœ¨

ðŸŸ¢ Easy Level

Problem Kya Hai?

Do strings s aur t diye gaye hain. Tumhe batana hai ki kya t string s ka anagram hai ya nahi.

Anagram Kya Hota Hai?

Anagram matlab ek word ke letters ko rearrange karke doosra word banana. Dono words mein same characters hone chahiye, same frequency ke saath!

ðŸŽ¯ Example: "listen" aur "silent" â†’ true (same letters, different order)
ðŸŽ¯ Example: "rat" aur "car" â†’ false (different letters)
ðŸŽ¯ Example: "anagram" aur "nagaram" â†’ true âœ…
1

Sorting Approach

Intuition (Sochne Ka Tarika)

Agar do strings anagram hain, toh unme exactly same characters honge with same frequencies! ðŸ§©

Toh simple idea: Dono strings ko sort kar do! Agar anagram hain, toh sorting ke baad dono strings identical ho jayengi.

ðŸ’­ "listen" â†’ "eilnst" aur "silent" â†’ "eilnst" â€” dono same! âœ¨

Algorithm (Steps)

  1. Pehle lengths check karo â€” agar different hain, toh directly false
  2. Dono strings ko sort karo
  3. Sorted strings ko compare karo
  4. Agar equal hain â†’ true, warna â†’ false
Python 
class Solution:
    def isAnagram(self, s: str, t: str) -> bool:
        if len(s) != len(t):
            return False
        
        return sorted(s) == sorted(t)

Time & Space Complexity

â±ï¸ Time Complexity
O(n log n)
n log n + m log m
ðŸ’¾ Space Complexity
O(n + m)
or O(1) - algo pe depend
2

Hash Map Approach

Intuition (Sochne Ka Tarika)

Sorting ki jagah, hum directly character frequencies count kar sakte hain! ðŸ“Š

Do hash maps (dictionaries) banao â€” ek string s ke liye, ek string t ke liye. Har character kitni baar aaya, wo count karo.

ðŸ’­ Jaise exam mein attendance le rahe ho â€” dono classes ke students ki count karke match karo!

Algorithm (Steps)

  1. Length check â€” different hain toh false
  2. Do empty dictionaries banao: countS aur countT
  3. Dono strings pe simultaneously loop lagao
  4. Har character ka count apne dictionary mein increment karo
  5. End mein dono dictionaries compare karo
Python 
class Solution:
    def isAnagram(self, s: str, t: str) -> bool:
        if len(s) != len(t):
            return False
        
        countS, countT = {}, {}
        
        for i in range(len(s)):
            countS[s[i]] = 1 + countS.get(s[i], 0)
            countT[t[i]] = 1 + countT.get(t[i], 0)
        
        return countS == countT

Time & Space Complexity

â±ï¸ Time Complexity
O(n + m)
Linear scan!
ðŸ’¾ Space Complexity
O(1)
Max 26 characters
ðŸš€ Better than sorting! Space O(1) kyunki max 26 unique lowercase letters hi ho sakte hain.
3

Hash Table using Array ðŸŽ¯

Intuition (Sochne Ka Tarika)

Problem mein sirf lowercase English letters (a-z). Toh ek fixed-size array of 26 use karein! ðŸ’¡

Smart trick: String s ke liye count increment, string t ke liye decrement. End mein sab 0 hona chahiye! ðŸŽ‰

ðŸ’­ Bank balance jaise â€” deposit (s) aur withdrawal (t). Match kare toh balance zero!
Python 
class Solution:
    def isAnagram(self, s: str, t: str) -> bool:
        if len(s) != len(t):
            return False
        
        count = [0] * 26  # 26 letters ke liye
        
        for i in range(len(s)):
            count[ord(s[i]) - ord('a')] += 1  # increment
            count[ord(t[i]) - ord('a')] -= 1  # decrement
        
        for val in count:
            if val != 0:
                return False
        return True

ord() Function Kya Karta Hai?

ord('a') - ord('a') = 0 â†’ index 0
ord('b') - ord('a') = 1 â†’ index 1
ord('z') - ord('a') = 25 â†’ index 25
Har character ka unique index! ðŸ”¢

Time & Space Complexity

â±ï¸ Time Complexity
O(n + m)
ðŸ’¾ Space Complexity
O(1)
Fixed 26 size
âš¡ Most Efficient! No hashing overhead, simple array. Interview mein impressive!
âš ï¸

Common Galtiyan (Pitfalls)

Length Check Bhool Jana

Agar do strings ki lengths different hain, toh wo kabhi anagram nahi ho sakte! Always first step: if len(s) != len(t): return False

Case Sensitivity Issue

Is problem mein sirf lowercase letters hain. But agar mixed case allow ho:

Python âŒ Wrong 
# "Listen" != "silent"
return sorted(s) == sorted(t)
Python âœ… Correct 
s = s.lower()
t = t.lower()
return sorted(s) == sorted(t)

ðŸ“‹ Quick Comparison Table

Approach Time Space Notes
Sorting O(n log n) O(n) Simple but slower
Hash Map O(n) O(1) Fast with dicts
Array BEST O(n) O(1) Most efficient! âš¡
ðŸ“š Problem #3

Two Sum

Array mein do numbers dhoondo jinke sum se target bane! ðŸŽ¯âž•

ðŸŸ¢ Easy Level

Problem Kya Hai?

Ek integer array nums aur ek integer target diya gaya hai. Tumhe do numbers ke indices return karne hain jinke sum se target ban jaye. Matlab nums[i] + nums[j] == target aur i != j.

Important Points

âœ… Exactly ek valid answer hamesha exist karega
âœ… Same element ko do baar use nahi kar sakte
âœ… Answer mein smaller index pehle aana chahiye

ðŸŽ¯ Example 1: nums = [3,4,5,6], target = 7 â†’ [0,1] (3+4=7)
ðŸŽ¯ Example 2: nums = [4,5,6], target = 10 â†’ [0,2] (4+6=10)
ðŸŽ¯ Example 3: nums = [5,5], target = 10 â†’ [0,1] (5+5=10)

ðŸŽ­ Real-life Analogy â€” Party Mein Partner Dhundho!

Scenario: Socho ek party mein sabke paas kuch paise hain. Tumhe do logo ko dhundhna hai jinke paas milake exactly â‚¹100 ho. ðŸ’°ðŸ’°

Brute Force (Slow): Har aadmi ko har doosre aadmi ke paas jao, paise count karo â€” "Bhai, tere paas kitne? Mere paas 40, tere paas 60? Chalo, 100 ho gaye!" ðŸš¶â€â™‚ï¸ðŸš¶

Smart Approach (HashMap): Ek register maintain karo jismein likho ki "Mere paas 40 hain, mujhe 60 wala chahiye!" Ab jab 60 wala aaye, register check kare â€” "60 chahiye kisko? Oh, 40 wale ko! Match ho gaya!" ðŸŽ¯

ðŸ’¡ Key Insight: Agar tumhe target banana hai aur tumhare paas x hai, toh tumhe target - x dhundhna hai! Ye "complement" kehlaata hai. HashMap se complement O(1) mein mil jaata hai! âš¡

ðŸŽ¤ Interview Tips â€” Ye Problem FAANG Favourite Hai!

  • ðŸ”¥ Ye LeetCode #1 hai! Almost har interview mein poochha jaata hai â€” ye problem achhe se yaad karo!
  • â“ Clarifying questions poochho: "Kya array sorted hai?" (agar haan toh Two Pointer bhi use ho sakta hai), "Kya negative numbers ho sakte hain?", "Kya multiple valid answers ho sakte hain?"
  • ðŸ§  Complement concept explain karo: "Main ye dekh raha hun ki target - current = complement. Agar complement already dekha hai toh answer mil gaya!"
  • âš¡ One-pass vs Two-pass: Two-pass pehle batao, phir optimize karke One-pass batao â€” ye dikhata hai ki tum iteratively improve kar sakte ho!
  • ðŸ”„ Edge case mention karo: [5, 5] with target=10 â€” same value do jagah! Ye one-pass mein handle hota hai par two-pass mein tricky hai

â“ Common Follow-up Questions â€” Tayyar Raho!

Q1: "Agar array sorted ho toh kaise optimize karoge?"
â†’ Two Pointer technique! Left = 0, Right = n-1. Sum zyada ho toh right--, kam ho toh left++. O(1) space!

Q2: "Agar 3 numbers ka sum chahiye?" (3Sum Problem)
â†’ Ek number fix karo, baaki two ke liye Two Sum lagao. Sorting + Two Pointers se O(nÂ²) mein ho jaata hai!

Q3: "Agar saare valid pairs return karne ho, sirf ek nahi?"
â†’ HashMap mein list of indices store karo. Result list maintain karo. Duplicates handle karo carefully!

Q4: "Agar target ke closest sum dhundhna ho (exact na mile toh)?"
â†’ Sorting + Two Pointers. Har step pe closest track karo. 3Sum Closest problem hai ye!

1

Brute Force Approach

Intuition (Sochne Ka Tarika)

Sabse simple approach â€” har possible pair try karo! ðŸ”„

Do nested loops lagao. Pehle element pick karo, phir baaki sab elements ke saath add karke dekho. Agar sum target ke barabar aa gaya, toh wo dono indices return kar do!

ðŸ’­ Socho jaise party mein 2 logon ko dhundna hai jinke paas milake exactly â‚¹100 ho. Har ek ko har doosre se poochna padega!

Algorithm (Steps)

  1. Outer loop i se array traverse karo (0 se n-1)
  2. Inner loop j ko i+1 se start karo (same element avoid)
  3. Check karo: nums[i] + nums[j] == target?
  4. Agar haan â†’ [i, j] return karo
  5. Nahi mila toh loop continue...
Python 
class Solution:
    def twoSum(self, nums: List[int], target: int) -> List[int]:
        for i in range(len(nums)):
            for j in range(i + 1, len(nums)):
                if nums[i] + nums[j] == target:
                    return [i, j]
        return []  # kabhi nahi aayega (guaranteed answer)

Time & Space Complexity

â±ï¸ Time Complexity
O(nÂ²)
ðŸ’¾ Space Complexity
O(1)
ðŸ˜… Slow hai! Har pair check kar rahe hain â€” n elements ke liye almost nÂ² comparisons.
2

Hash Map - Two Pass

Intuition (Sochne Ka Tarika)

Key insight: Agar hume nums[i] pata hai aur target pata hai, toh hum dusra number calculate kar sakte hain! ðŸ§®

complement = target - nums[i]
Ab bas ye complement array mein hai ya nahi, ye O(1) mein check karna hai. Hash Map perfect hai iske liye!

ðŸ’­ Jaise agar target â‚¹100 hai aur tumhare paas â‚¹40 hai, toh dusre ke paas exactly â‚¹60 hone chahiye. Ab â‚¹60 wala dhundo â€” fast dhundna hai toh phone book (hash map) use karo!

Algorithm (Steps)

  1. First Pass: Poori array traverse karo, har number:index pair ko hash map mein daalo
  2. Second Pass: Phir se traverse karo
  3. Har element ke liye complement = target - nums[i] calculate karo
  4. Check karo: complement hash map mein hai? Aur khud nahi hai (i != j)?
  5. Agar milgaya â†’ dono indices return karo!
Python 
class Solution:
    def twoSum(self, nums: List[int], target: int) -> List[int]:
        # First Pass: Build the hash map
        numToIndex = {}
        for i, num in enumerate(nums):
            numToIndex[num] = i
        
        # Second Pass: Find the complement
        for i, num in enumerate(nums):
            complement = target - num
            if complement in numToIndex and numToIndex[complement] != i:
                return [i, numToIndex[complement]]
        
        return []

Time & Space Complexity

â±ï¸ Time Complexity
O(n)
2 passes = O(n) + O(n)
ðŸ’¾ Space Complexity
O(n)
Hash map storage
ðŸš€ Much better! nÂ² se n pe aa gaye. Hash map ke kaaran lookup O(1) mein ho jata hai.
3

Hash Map - One Pass ðŸŽ¯

Intuition (Sochne Ka Tarika)

Kya hum ek hi pass mein kaam kar sakte hain? Haan! ðŸ”¥

Jaise jaise array traverse karte hain, simultaneously check karte jao ki current element ka complement pehle se map mein hai ya nahi.

Agar hai â†’ answer mil gaya! Nahi hai â†’ current element ko map mein daal do future ke liye.

ðŸ’­ Jaise train mein seat dhund rahe ho. Har seat pe jaake pehle check karo â€” "kya mera partner already yahan baitha hai?" Nahi hai toh apna naam likh do ki "main yahan hun, mera partner baad mein aaye toh mil jayega!"

Algorithm (Steps)

  1. Ek empty hash map banao
  2. Array traverse karo (index i, value num)
  3. complement = target - num calculate karo
  4. Check: kya complement pehle se map mein hai?
  5. Agar hai â†’ [map[complement], i] return karo
  6. Nahi hai â†’ map[num] = i add karo
  7. Continue until found!
Python 
class Solution:
    def twoSum(self, nums: List[int], target: int) -> List[int]:
        prevMap = {}  # num -> index
        
        for i, num in enumerate(nums):
            complement = target - num
            
            # Kya complement pehle dekha hai?
            if complement in prevMap:
                return [prevMap[complement], i]
            
            # Current num ko map mein daalo
            prevMap[num] = i
        
        return []

Kyun Kaam Karta Hai?

Jab hum index i pe hain, tab tak 0 se i-1 tak ke saare elements already map mein hain. Toh agar complement pehle aaya tha, toh mil jayega!

Aur agar complement baad mein aayega, toh tab tak current element map mein hoga, toh tab match ho jayega. Win-win! ðŸŽ‰

ðŸ§  Kyun Ye Approach Sabse Best Hai? â€” Deep Dive!

Magic: Hum "need" store kar rahe hain, "want" dhundh rahe hain!

Har element ke liye:
1ï¸âƒ£ "Main X hun. Mujhe target banana hai. Mujhe (target - X) chahiye!" â€” Ye check karo ki pehle aaya tha kya?
2ï¸âƒ£ Nahi mila? "Theek hai, main apna address chhod ke jaata hun. Jisko main chahiye, wo baad mein aayega toh mujhe dhundh lega!" ðŸ“

ðŸ’¡ Interview Insight: Ye pattern "complement finding" kehlaata hai. Bohot saari problems mein use hota hai â€” Two Sum, Three Sum, Four Sum, aur bhi kaafi! Ek baar samajh lo, bahut kaam aayega! ðŸ”¥

ðŸ“‹ Step-by-Step Dry Run â€” Visualize Karo!

Input: nums = [2, 7, 11, 15], target = 9

Stepinumcomplement (9-num)prevMapcomplement in map?Action
Start - - - {} - Initialize empty map
1 0 2 7 {} âŒ No (map empty) Add 2â†’0: {2:0}
2 1 7 2 {2:0} âœ… YES! 2 hai! ðŸŽ‰ Return [0, 1]
ðŸ‘† Dekho! Jab 7 aaya (index 1), usne pucha "mujhe 2 chahiye (9-7=2)". Map mein dekha â€” 2 index 0 pe hai! Match found: [0, 1] â€” Sirf 2 iterations mein answer! ðŸš€

Time & Space Complexity

â±ï¸ Time Complexity
O(n)
Single pass! ðŸš€
ðŸ’¾ Space Complexity
O(n)
Hash map storage
âš¡ Best approach! Sirf ek baar array traverse karna hai. Interview mein ye approach sabse zyada impress karegi!
âš ï¸

Common Galtiyan (Pitfalls)

Same Element Ko Do Baar Use Karna

Problem mein clearly bola hai i != j. Matlab same element ko do baar use nahi kar sakte!

Python âŒ Wrong 
# [3,3] target=6 pe galat
if complement in numToIndex:
    return [i, numToIndex[complement]]
Python âœ… Correct 
# Index check karo!
if complement in numToIndex \
   and numToIndex[complement] != i:
    return [i, numToIndex[complement]]
ðŸ’¡ One-pass approach mein ye automatically handle ho jata hai kyunki hum current element ko baad mein map mein daalte hain!

Duplicate Values Handle Karna

Array mein same values ho sakti hain jaise [5, 5]. Two-pass mein map overwrite ho jata hai, par one-pass mein sahi se handle hota hai.

ðŸ’¡ [5, 5] target=10 â†’ One-pass mein jab second 5 pe aate hain, tab first 5 already map mein hai. Complement 10-5=5 milega, indices [0,1] return!

Index Order Galat Dena

Problem kehta hai smaller index first. One-pass mein [prevMap[complement], i] automatically correct order deta hai kyunki prevMap wala index hamesha current i se chhota hoga!

ðŸ“‹ Quick Comparison Table

Approach Time Space Notes
Brute Force O(nÂ²) O(1) Simple but slow
Two Pass Hash O(n) O(n) 2 loops, fast lookup
One Pass BEST O(n) O(n) Single loop! âš¡
ðŸ“š Problem #4

Group Anagrams

Similar characters wale strings ko groups mein baanto! ðŸ”¤ðŸ“¦

ðŸŸ¡ Medium Level

Problem Kya Hai?

Ek array of strings strs diya gaya hai. Tumhe saare anagrams ko group karke sublists mein return karna hai. Output kisi bhi order mein ho sakta hai.

Anagram Kya Hota Hai?

Do strings anagram hain agar unme exact same characters hain, bas order different ho sakta hai.
ðŸ“Œ "act" aur "cat" â†’ Anagrams! (a, c, t same hain)
ðŸ“Œ "stop" aur "pots" â†’ Anagrams! (s, t, o, p same hain)

ðŸŽ¯ Example 1: ["act","pots","tops","cat","stop","hat"]
â†’ [["hat"],["act", "cat"],["stop", "pots", "tops"]]

ðŸŽ¯ Example 2: ["x"] â†’ [["x"]]
ðŸŽ¯ Example 3: [""] â†’ [[""]]

Constraints: 1 â‰¤ strs.length â‰¤ 1000, lowercase English letters only
1

Sorting as Key

Intuition (Sochne Ka Tarika)

Key insight: Agar do strings anagrams hain, toh sort karne ke baad wo identical ho jayenge! ðŸŽ¯

"cat" â†’ sort â†’ "act"
"act" â†’ sort â†’ "act"
"tac" â†’ sort â†’ "act"
Sab same! Toh sorted string ko key bana ke hash map mein group kar sakte hain.

ðŸ’­ Socho jaise jumbled letters ka puzzle ho â€” sab letters ko alphabetically arrange karo, same letters wale ek hi answer denge!

Algorithm (Steps)

  1. Ek hash map banao (sorted_string â†’ list of original strings)
  2. Har string ke liye:
  3. String ko sort karo â†’ ye hamari key hai
  4. Is key ke against original string ko list mein add karo
  5. Finally, hash map ki saari values return karo!
Python 
class Solution:
    def groupAnagrams(self, strs: List[str]) -> List[List[str]]:
        anagramGroups = {}  # sorted_str -> list of original strings
        
        for s in strs:
            # Sort the string to get the key
            sortedStr = ''.join(sorted(s))
            
            # Add to the group
            if sortedStr not in anagramGroups:
                anagramGroups[sortedStr] = []
            anagramGroups[sortedStr].append(s)
        
        return list(anagramGroups.values())

Dry Run Example

Input: ["act", "cat", "pots", "stop"]

"act" â†’ sorted: "act" â†’ map: {"act": ["act"]}
"cat" â†’ sorted: "act" â†’ map: {"act": ["act", "cat"]}
"pots" â†’ sorted: "opst" â†’ map: {"act": [...], "opst": ["pots"]}
"stop" â†’ sorted: "opst" â†’ map: {"act": [...], "opst": ["pots", "stop"]}

Output: [["act", "cat"], ["pots", "stop"]] âœ…

Time & Space Complexity

â±ï¸ Time Complexity
O(n Ã— k log k)
n strings, each of length k sorted
ðŸ’¾ Space Complexity
O(n Ã— k)
Hash map storage
ðŸ“Š Sorting ka overhead hai (k log k per string), par simple aur clean solution hai!
2

Character Count as Key ðŸŽ¯

Intuition (Sochne Ka Tarika)

Sorting se better idea: Character frequency hi key ban sakti hai! ðŸ”¥

"cat" â†’ {a:1, c:1, t:1}
"act" â†’ {a:1, c:1, t:1}
"tac" â†’ {a:1, c:1, t:1}
Same frequency = Same group! Ab sorting ki zaroorat nahi.

Par dictionary hashable nahi hoti Python mein. Toh hum ek tuple banayenge jo 26 letters ki count represent kare!

ðŸ’­ Socho jaise har word ka "fingerprint" bana rahe ho â€” kitne 'a', kitne 'b'... Same fingerprint wale ek group mein!

Algorithm (Steps)

  1. Ek defaultdict(list) banao
  2. Har string ke liye:
  3. Size 26 ka count array banao (a-z ke liye)
  4. Har character ki frequency count karo
  5. Array ko tuple mein convert karo (hashable key ke liye)
  6. Is tuple key ke against string add karo
  7. Hash map ki values return karo!
Python 
from collections import defaultdict

class Solution:
    def groupAnagrams(self, strs: List[str]) -> List[List[str]]:
        anagramGroups = defaultdict(list)  # count_tuple -> list of strings
        
        for s in strs:
            # Create character count array (26 letters)
            count = [0] * 26
            
            for char in s:
                count[ord(char) - ord('a')] += 1
            
            # Tuple as key (lists aren't hashable)
            anagramGroups[tuple(count)].append(s)
        
        return list(anagramGroups.values())

Kyun Tuple Use Karte Hain?

Python mein dictionary keys hashable honi chahiye.
âŒ List â†’ Mutable, not hashable
âœ… Tuple â†’ Immutable, hashable!

tuple([1,0,0,1,0,...,1]) â†’ (1,0,0,1,0,...,1)
Ab ye key ban sakti hai! ðŸ”‘

ord() Function Kya Karta Hai?

ord('a') = 97, ord('b') = 98, ...
ord(char) - ord('a') â†’ 0-25 ka index milta hai!

'a' â†’ 0, 'b' â†’ 1, 'c' â†’ 2, ... 'z' â†’ 25

Time & Space Complexity

â±ï¸ Time Complexity
O(n Ã— k)
No sorting! Just counting ðŸš€
ðŸ’¾ Space Complexity
O(n Ã— k)
Hash map storage
âš¡ Best approach! Sorting hatane se O(k log k) â†’ O(k) ho gaya per string. Interview mein ye approach sabse impressive hai!
âš ï¸

Common Galtiyan (Pitfalls)

List Ko Directly Key Banana

Python mein list hashable nahi hoti!

Python âŒ Wrong 
# TypeError!
map[count].append(s)  # count is list
Python âœ… Correct 
# Convert to tuple first!
map[tuple(count)].append(s)

Empty String Handle Karna

Empty string "" bhi valid input hai! Iske liye:
â€¢ Sorted: "" â†’ "" (works!)
â€¢ Count: all zeros tuple (0,0,0,...) (works!)
Dono approaches automatically handle kar lete hain. ðŸ‘

defaultdict vs Regular dict

Regular dict mein pehle check karna padta hai key exists ya nahi. defaultdict(list) automatically empty list create karta hai!

Python ðŸ˜ Verbose 
if key not in d:
    d[key] = []
d[key].append(s)
Python âœ… Clean 
# defaultdict auto-creates!
d[key].append(s)

ðŸ“‹ Quick Comparison Table

Approach Time Space Notes
Sorting as Key O(n Ã— k log k) O(n Ã— k) Simple, intuitive
Char Count BEST O(n Ã— k) O(n Ã— k) Fastest! No sorting âš¡
ðŸ“Œ n = number of strings, k = average length of strings
ðŸ“š Problem #5

Top K Frequent Elements

Array mein sabse zyada baar aane wale K elements dhundo! ðŸ“ŠðŸ”

ðŸŸ¡ Medium Level

Problem Kya Hai?

Ek integer array nums aur ek integer k diya gaya hai. Tumhe array ke k most frequent elements return karne hain. Matlab jo elements sabse zyada baar aaye hain, unme se top k.

Important Points

âœ… Answer hamesha unique hoga (test cases aise hain)
âœ… Output kisi bhi order mein de sakte ho
âœ… k hamesha â‰¤ distinct elements ki count hogi

ðŸŽ¯ Example 1: nums = [1,2,2,3,3,3], k = 2
â†’ [2,3] ya [3,2] (3 appears 3x, 2 appears 2x â€” top 2 frequent)

ðŸŽ¯ Example 2: nums = [7,7], k = 1 â†’ [7]

Constraints: 1 â‰¤ nums.length â‰¤ 10â´, -1000 â‰¤ nums[i] â‰¤ 1000
1

Sorting Approach

Intuition (Sochne Ka Tarika)

Sabse simple approach: Pehle frequency count karo, phir frequency ke basis pe sort karo, aur top k elements le lo!

ðŸ’­ Jaise class mein attendance ke hisaab se top k students dhundne hain â€” pehle sabki attendance count karo, phir highest se lowest sort karo, top k names le lo!

Algorithm (Steps)

  1. Counter/HashMap se har element ki frequency count karo
  2. Frequencies ko descending order mein sort karo
  3. Top k elements return karo
Python 
from collections import Counter

class Solution:
    def topKFrequent(self, nums: List[int], k: int) -> List[int]:
        # Count frequencies
        count = Counter(nums)
        
        # Sort by frequency (descending) and take top k
        sorted_items = sorted(count.keys(), key=lambda x: count[x], reverse=True)
        
        return sorted_items[:k]

Time & Space Complexity

â±ï¸ Time Complexity
O(n log n)
Sorting dominates
ðŸ’¾ Space Complexity
O(n)
HashMap storage
2

Min Heap Approach

Intuition (Sochne Ka Tarika)

Sorting se better: Heap use karo! ðŸ“š

Hum ek Min Heap of size k maintain karenge. Jab bhi heap size k se zyada ho, sabse chhoti frequency wala element pop kar do. End mein heap mein sirf top k frequent elements bachenge!

ðŸ’­ Socho jaise ek choti si basket hai jisme sirf k cheezein aa sakti hain. Jab nayi cheez daalni ho aur basket full ho, toh sabse kam valuable cheez nikaal do!

Algorithm (Steps)

  1. Counter se frequencies count karo
  2. Ek Min Heap banao (Python mein heapq by default min heap hai)
  3. Har (frequency, element) pair ko heap mein daalo
  4. Agar heap size > k â†’ heappop karo (smallest frequency nikalta hai)
  5. End mein heap se saare elements return karo
Python 
import heapq
from collections import Counter

class Solution:
    def topKFrequent(self, nums: List[int], k: int) -> List[int]:
        count = Counter(nums)
        
        # Min heap of size k
        minHeap = []
        
        for num, freq in count.items():
            heapq.heappush(minHeap, (freq, num))
            
            # Keep only k elements
            if len(minHeap) > k:
                heapq.heappop(minHeap)  # Remove smallest freq
        
        # Extract elements from heap
        return [num for freq, num in minHeap]

Kyun Min Heap? Max Heap Nahi?

ðŸ¤” Counter-intuitive lagta hai, par suno:

â€¢ Hum top k frequent chahte hain
â€¢ Min Heap mein sabse chhota element root pe hota hai
â€¢ Jab heap size > k, hum smallest frequency pop karte hain
â€¢ Isse sirf k biggest frequencies bachti hain!

Max Heap use karte toh saara data sort karna padta (n log n). Min Heap se sirf k elements maintain karte hain (n log k)!

Time & Space Complexity

â±ï¸ Time Complexity
O(n log k)
Better than sorting! ðŸš€
ðŸ’¾ Space Complexity
O(n + k)
HashMap + Heap
ðŸ“Š Jab k << n (k bahut chhota), tab O(n log k) is much better than O(n log n)!
3

Bucket Sort Approach ðŸŽ¯

Intuition (Sochne Ka Tarika)

Sabse clever approach! ðŸ§  Heap bhi nahi chahiye.

Key insight: Maximum possible frequency kya ho sakti hai? n (array length)!
Toh hum n+1 buckets bana sakte hain, jahan bucket[i] mein wo elements hain jinki frequency exactly i hai.

Phir buckets ko reverse order mein traverse karo (highest frequency first) aur k elements collect karo!

ðŸ’­ Socho jaise school mein marks ke hisaab se shelves hain â€” 100 marks wali shelf, 99 marks wali, 98... Highest shelf se dekhna shuru karo, top k students mil jayenge!

Algorithm (Steps)

  1. Counter se frequencies count karo
  2. Size n+1 ka bucket array banao (index = frequency)
  3. Har element ko uski frequency wale bucket mein daalo
  4. Buckets ko reverse mein traverse karo (n se 1 tak)
  5. Jab tak k elements nahi mil jaate, elements collect karo
Python 
from collections import Counter

class Solution:
    def topKFrequent(self, nums: List[int], k: int) -> List[int]:
        count = Counter(nums)
        n = len(nums)
        
        # Create buckets: bucket[i] = elements with frequency i
        buckets = [[] for _ in range(n + 1)]
        
        for num, freq in count.items():
            buckets[freq].append(num)
        
        # Collect k elements from highest frequency buckets
        result = []
        for freq in range(n, 0, -1):  # n to 1 (reverse)
            for num in buckets[freq]:
                result.append(num)
                if len(result) == k:
                    return result
        
        return result

Dry Run Example

nums = [1,1,1,2,2,3], k = 2

Step 1: count = {1:3, 2:2, 3:1}
Step 2: buckets (index = frequency):
â€¢ bucket[1] = [3] (freq 1)
â€¢ bucket[2] = [2] (freq 2)
â€¢ bucket[3] = [1] (freq 3)

Step 3: Traverse reverse (3â†’1):
â€¢ freq=3: add 1 â†’ result=[1]
â€¢ freq=2: add 2 â†’ result=[1,2] â†’ len=k, STOP!

Output: [1, 2] âœ…

Time & Space Complexity

â±ï¸ Time Complexity
O(n)
No sorting/heap! âš¡
ðŸ’¾ Space Complexity
O(n)
Buckets + HashMap
âš¡ Best approach! Linear time mein kaam ho gaya. Interview mein is approach se interviewer impress ho jayega! ðŸ˜Ž
âš ï¸

Common Galtiyan (Pitfalls)

Heap mein (frequency, element) ka Order

Python heap first element ke basis pe compare karta hai. Frequency pehle daalo taaki sorting frequency pe ho!

Python âŒ Wrong 
# Sorts by element, not freq!
heapq.heappush(heap, (num, freq))
Python âœ… Correct 
# Sorts by frequency!
heapq.heappush(heap, (freq, num))

Bucket Array Size

Bucket array ki size n+1 honi chahiye, n nahi! Kyunki frequency 0 se n tak ho sakti hai (index 0 se n).

ðŸ’¡ Agar array = [5,5,5,5,5] (length 5), toh 5 ki frequency = 5. Bucket[5] access karne ke liye size minimum 6 chahiye!

Counter.most_common() Shortcut

Python mein ek shortcut hai! Par interview mein pata hona chahiye underlying logic.

Python ðŸ˜Ž One-liner 
def topKFrequent(self, nums, k):
    return [x for x, _ in Counter(nums).most_common(k)]

ðŸ“‹ Quick Comparison Table

Approach Time Space Notes
Sorting O(n log n) O(n) Simple, straightforward
Min Heap O(n log k) O(n + k) Better when k << n
Bucket Sort BEST O(n) O(n) Linear time! âš¡
ðŸ“Œ Pro tip: Bucket sort tab use karo jab frequency range bounded ho (yahan max freq = n).
ðŸ“š Problem #6

Encode and Decode Strings

List of strings ko ek single string mein encode karo aur wapas decode karo! ðŸ”ðŸ”“

ðŸŸ¡ Medium Level

Problem Kya Hai?

Design karo ek algorithm jo list of strings ko ek single string mein encode kare, aur phir us encoded string ko wapas original list of strings mein decode kare.

Kyun Tricky Hai?

âš ï¸ Strings mein koi bhi character ho sakta hai â€” comma, space, special symbols, even empty string!
âœ… Tumhara encoding scheme robust hona chahiye taaki kisi bhi character se break na ho.
âœ… Decode karne pe exactly original strings wapas milni chahiye.

ðŸŽ¯ Example 1: ["neet","code","love","you"]
encode â†’ "4#neet4#code4#love3#you"
decode â†’ ["neet","code","love","you"] âœ…

ðŸŽ¯ Example 2: ["we","say",":","yes"]
encode â†’ "2#we3#say1#:3#yes" â†’ special characters bhi handle! âœ…
1

Length Array + Separator

Intuition (Sochne Ka Tarika)

Key insight: Agar hum har string ki length pehle se store kar lein, toh decoding mein exactly pata hoga ki kitne characters padhne hain! ðŸŽ¯

Strategy:
1. Pehle saari lengths comma-separated likho
2. Phir # lagao as boundary
3. Phir saari strings back-to-back append karo

ðŸ’­ Jaise parcel bhejte time pehle ek list likhte ho â€” "item1: 2kg, item2: 3kg, item3: 1kg" phir actual items pack karte ho. Receiver ko weight se pata chal jayega kaunsa item kahan khatam hota hai!

Algorithm (Steps)

ðŸ” Encoding Steps

  1. Agar list empty hai â†’ empty string return karo
  2. Har string ki length ek list mein store karo
  3. Saari lengths ko comma-separated string mein likho
  4. # lagao as separator
  5. Phir saari original strings append karo

ðŸ”“ Decoding Steps

  1. Agar string empty hai â†’ empty list return karo
  2. # tak padho aur lengths extract karo
  3. # ke baad, har length ke hisaab se substring nikalo
  4. Result list mein add karte jao
Python 
class Solution:
    def encode(self, strs: List[str]) -> str:
        if not strs:
            return ""
        
        sizes = []  # Store all lengths
        res = ""
        
        # Collect all lengths
        for s in strs:
            sizes.append(len(s))
        
        # Write lengths with comma separator
        for sz in sizes:
            res += str(sz) + ','
        
        res += '#'  # Boundary marker
        
        # Append all strings
        for s in strs:
            res += s
        
        return res

    def decode(self, s: str) -> List[str]:
        if not s:
            return []
        
        sizes, res, i = [], [], 0
        
        # Extract all sizes until '#'
        while s[i] != '#':
            cur = ""
            while s[i] != ',':
                cur += s[i]
                i += 1
            sizes.append(int(cur))
            i += 1  # Skip comma
        
        i += 1  # Skip '#'
        
        # Extract strings based on sizes
        for sz in sizes:
            res.append(s[i:i + sz])
            i += sz
        
        return res

Dry Run Example

Input: ["hi", "bye"]

Encode:
â€¢ sizes = [2, 3]
â€¢ res = "2,3,#hibye"

Decode: "2,3,#hibye"
â€¢ Read until #: sizes = [2, 3]
â€¢ After #: "hibye"
â€¢ Read 2 chars: "hi" â†’ res = ["hi"]
â€¢ Read 3 chars: "bye" â†’ res = ["hi", "bye"] âœ…

Time & Space Complexity

â±ï¸ Time Complexity
O(m)
m = total chars in all strings
ðŸ’¾ Space Complexity
O(m + n)
m chars + n lengths stored
2

Length Prefix (Optimal) ðŸŽ¯

Intuition (Sochne Ka Tarika)

Aur bhi simple approach: Inline length prefixing! ðŸ”¥

Har string ke liye directly length#string format use karo.
Pehle saari lengths collect karne ki zaroorat nahi â€” stream mein encode/decode kar sakte ho!

ðŸ’­ Jaise WhatsApp voice message mein pehle duration dikhta hai phir message â€” "0:05" message. Har message ka apna duration prefix hota hai, sab ek saath collect nahi karte!

Algorithm (Steps)

ðŸ” Encoding (Super Simple!)

  1. Har string ke liye:
  2. length nikalo
  3. "length#string" format mein append karo
  4. Bas! ðŸŽ‰

ðŸ”“ Decoding

  1. Pointer i = 0 se shuru karo
  2. Jab tak string khatam na ho:
  3. Pointer j ko aage badhao jab tak # na mile
  4. s[i:j] se length extract karo
  5. # ke baad length characters padho â†’ original string!
  6. i ko aage move karo next segment ke liye
Python 
class Solution:
    def encode(self, strs: List[str]) -> str:
        res = ""
        for s in strs:
            res += str(len(s)) + "#" + s
        return res

    def decode(self, s: str) -> List[str]:
        res = []
        i = 0
        
        while i < len(s):
            # Find the '#' separator
            j = i
            while s[j] != '#':
                j += 1
            
            # Extract length
            length = int(s[i:j])
            
            # Move past '#'
            i = j + 1
            
            # Extract the string of 'length' characters
            j = i + length
            res.append(s[i:j])
            
            # Move to next segment
            i = j
        
        return res

Dry Run Example

Input: ["hello", "world"]

Encode:
â€¢ "hello" â†’ "5#hello"
â€¢ "world" â†’ "5#world"
â€¢ Result: "5#hello5#world"

Decode: "5#hello5#world"
â€¢ i=0, find #: j=1, length=5
â€¢ i=2, read 5 chars: "hello" âœ“
â€¢ i=7, find #: j=8, length=5
â€¢ i=9, read 5 chars: "world" âœ“
â€¢ Output: ["hello", "world"] âœ…

Kyun # Safe Hai?

ðŸ¤” "Par agar string mein # ho toh?"

Koi problem nahi! Kyunki hum length se padhte hain, delimiter se nahi!

Example: ["a#b"]
â€¢ Encode: "3#a#b" (length 3, then a#b)
â€¢ Decode: Read "3", skip #, read 3 chars = "a#b" âœ…

Length-based approach kisi bhi character ke saath kaam karta hai! ðŸ’ª

Time & Space Complexity

â±ï¸ Time Complexity
O(m)
Single pass through all chars
ðŸ’¾ Space Complexity
O(m + n)
Output storage
âš¡ Optimal approach! Simpler code, same complexity, aur streaming-friendly bhi hai!
âš ï¸

Common Galtiyan (Pitfalls)

Simple Delimiter Use Karna (Comma, Space)

Agar tumne sirf comma ya space se strings join kiye, toh string mein comma aaye toh? Sab toot jayega!

Python âŒ Wrong 
# "hello,world" ke saath break!
encoded = ",".join(strs)
decoded = encoded.split(",")  # WRONG!
Python âœ… Correct 
# Length-based approach
res += str(len(s)) + "#" + s

Empty String Handle Karna

Edge cases:
â€¢ Empty list [] â†’ encode should return ""
â€¢ List with empty string [""] â†’ encode returns "0#"
Ye dono different hain! Properly distinguish karo.

ðŸ’¡ [""] encode â†’ "0#" (length 0, then empty string)
[] encode â†’ "" (nothing to encode)

Multi-Digit Length Parse Karna

Agar string ki length 10 ya usse zyada hai, toh length multi-digit hogi! Single digit assume mat karo.

Python âŒ Wrong 
# Assumes single digit length!
length = int(s[i])  # BREAKS for len >= 10
Python âœ… Correct 
# Read until # for full length
while s[j] != '#':
    j += 1
length = int(s[i:j])  # Handles any length!

ðŸ“‹ Quick Comparison Table

Approach Time Space Notes
Length Array + # O(m) O(m + n) Two-pass, stores lengths first
Inline Prefix BEST O(m) O(m + n) Simpler, streaming-friendly âš¡
ðŸ“Œ Key insight: Length-prefixing se koi bhi character (including delimiter) safely encode hota hai!
ðŸ“š Problem #7

Product of Array Except Self

Har index pe baaki sab elements ka product nikalo â€” bina division ke! âœ–ï¸âž¡ï¸âœ…

ðŸŸ¡ Medium Level

Problem Kya Hai?

Ek integer array nums diya gaya hai. Tumhe ek array output return karna hai jahan output[i] = product of all elements except nums[i].

Important Constraints

âš ï¸ Division operation use nahi kar sakte!
âœ… O(n) time mein solve karna hai
âœ… Product 32-bit integer mein fit hoga (guaranteed)

ðŸŽ¯ Example 1: nums = [1,2,4,6]
â†’ output[0] = 2Ã—4Ã—6 = 48
â†’ output[1] = 1Ã—4Ã—6 = 24
â†’ output[2] = 1Ã—2Ã—6 = 12
â†’ output[3] = 1Ã—2Ã—4 = 8
â†’ [48, 24, 12, 8]

ðŸŽ¯ Example 2: nums = [-1,0,1,2,3] â†’ [0,-6,0,0,0]
(0 hai array mein, toh baaki sab 0 except 0's position)
1

Brute Force

Intuition (Sochne Ka Tarika)

Sabse simple: Har index ke liye, baaki sab elements ka product manually calculate karo!

ðŸ’­ Jaise class mein har student ke liye baaki sabki marks ka average nikalna ho â€” ek ek karke sab ke liye alag se calculate karo.
Python 
class Solution:
    def productExceptSelf(self, nums: List[int]) -> List[int]:
        n = len(nums)
        result = []
        
        for i in range(n):
            product = 1
            for j in range(n):
                if i != j:
                    product *= nums[j]
            result.append(product)
        
        return result

Time & Space Complexity

â±ï¸ Time Complexity
O(nÂ²)
Nested loops
ðŸ’¾ Space Complexity
O(1)
Output excluded
ðŸ™… Interview mein ye approach mat batao â€” TLE (Time Limit Exceeded) aayega!
2

Division Approach (Not Allowed!)

Intuition (Sochne Ka Tarika)

Agar division allowed hoti: Total product / nums[i] = answer for index i.

Par ye approach problems create karti hai:
â€¢ Agar 0 hai array mein â†’ Division by zero!
â€¢ Problem explicitly says no division

ðŸ’­ Samjhne ke liye: [1,2,3,4] ka total product = 24.
index 0: 24/1 = 24, index 1: 24/2 = 12... par ye allowed nahi hai!
Python âŒ Not Allowed 
# DON'T USE THIS - Just for understanding
def productExceptSelf(self, nums):
    total = 1
    for num in nums:
        total *= num
    return [total // num for num in nums]  # WRONG!
3

Prefix & Suffix Products

Intuition (Sochne Ka Tarika)

Key insight: output[i] = (left side ka product) Ã— (right side ka product)! ðŸŽ¯

Hum do arrays banayenge:
â€¢ prefix[i] = product of all elements before index i
â€¢ suffix[i] = product of all elements after index i

Final answer: prefix[i] Ã— suffix[i]

ðŸ’­ Socho array ko beech mein kaat diya â€” left part ka product Ã— right part ka product = answer! [1, 2, | 4 |, 6] â†’ (1Ã—2) Ã— (6) = 12 for index 2.

Algorithm (Steps)

  1. prefix array banao: left to right traverse karte hue running product store karo
  2. suffix array banao: right to left traverse karte hue running product store karo
  3. Result: result[i] = prefix[i] Ã— suffix[i]
Python 
class Solution:
    def productExceptSelf(self, nums: List[int]) -> List[int]:
        n = len(nums)
        
        # prefix[i] = product of all elements before i
        prefix = [1] * n
        for i in range(1, n):
            prefix[i] = prefix[i - 1] * nums[i - 1]
        
        # suffix[i] = product of all elements after i
        suffix = [1] * n
        for i in range(n - 2, -1, -1):
            suffix[i] = suffix[i + 1] * nums[i + 1]
        
        # result[i] = prefix[i] * suffix[i]
        result = [1] * n
        for i in range(n):
            result[i] = prefix[i] * suffix[i]
        
        return result

Dry Run Example

nums = [1, 2, 3, 4]

Prefix (left products):
â€¢ prefix[0] = 1 (nothing before)
â€¢ prefix[1] = 1 (just nums[0])
â€¢ prefix[2] = 1Ã—2 = 2
â€¢ prefix[3] = 1Ã—2Ã—3 = 6
â†’ prefix = [1, 1, 2, 6]

Suffix (right products):
â€¢ suffix[3] = 1 (nothing after)
â€¢ suffix[2] = 4
â€¢ suffix[1] = 4Ã—3 = 12
â€¢ suffix[0] = 4Ã—3Ã—2 = 24
â†’ suffix = [24, 12, 4, 1]

Result: prefix Ã— suffix
â†’ [1Ã—24, 1Ã—12, 2Ã—4, 6Ã—1] = [24, 12, 8, 6] âœ…

Time & Space Complexity

â±ï¸ Time Complexity
O(n)
3 passes through array
ðŸ’¾ Space Complexity
O(n)
prefix + suffix arrays
4

Optimized - O(1) Extra Space ðŸŽ¯

Intuition (Sochne Ka Tarika)

Kya hum prefix aur suffix arrays hatake directly result mein calculate kar sakte hain? ðŸ¤”

Haan! Result array ko hi prefix array ki tarah use karo, phir right se traverse karte hue suffix multiply karte jao!

ðŸ’­ Pehle left side ka product result mein store karo. Phir right se aate hue ek variable mein right product track karo aur multiply karte jao!

Algorithm (Steps)

  1. First pass (left to right): result[i] mein prefix product store karo
  2. Ek variable suffix = 1 lo
  3. Second pass (right to left): result[i] Ã—= suffix, phir suffix Ã—= nums[i]
  4. Done! Result array ready hai
Python 
class Solution:
    def productExceptSelf(self, nums: List[int]) -> List[int]:
        n = len(nums)
        result = [1] * n
        
        # First pass: Store prefix products in result
        prefix = 1
        for i in range(n):
            result[i] = prefix
            prefix *= nums[i]
        
        # Second pass: Multiply with suffix products
        suffix = 1
        for i in range(n - 1, -1, -1):
            result[i] *= suffix
            suffix *= nums[i]
        
        return result

Dry Run Example (Step by Step)

nums = [1, 2, 3, 4]

First Pass (Left â†’ Right): Build prefix in result

i=0: result[0]=1, prefix=1Ã—1=1
i=1: result[1]=1, prefix=1Ã—2=2
i=2: result[2]=2, prefix=2Ã—3=6
i=3: result[3]=6, prefix=6Ã—4=24
result = [1, 1, 2, 6] (prefix products)

Second Pass (Right â†’ Left): Multiply suffix
i=3: result[3]=6Ã—1=6, suffix=1Ã—4=4
i=2: result[2]=2Ã—4=8, suffix=4Ã—3=12
i=1: result[1]=1Ã—12=12, suffix=12Ã—2=24
i=0: result[0]=1Ã—24=24, suffix=24Ã—1=24
result = [24, 12, 8, 6] âœ…

Time & Space Complexity

â±ï¸ Time Complexity
O(n)
2 passes only
ðŸ’¾ Space Complexity
O(1)
Output array not counted!
âš¡ Best approach! O(n) time, O(1) extra space. Interview mein ye approach se interviewer khush ho jayega! ðŸ˜Ž
âš ï¸

Common Galtiyan (Pitfalls)

Division Use Karna

Problem explicitly says no division! Plus zero handle karna mushkil ho jata hai.

Prefix/Suffix Array Initialize Karna

Prefix aur suffix arrays ko 1 se initialize karo, 0 se nahi! Kyunki multiplication identity 1 hai.

Python âŒ Wrong 
result = [0] * n  # Sab 0 ho jayenge!
Python âœ… Correct 
result = [1] * n  # Multiplication identity!

Zero Handle Karna

Agar array mein zero hai:
â€¢ Ek zero â†’ sirf us index pe non-zero answer hoga, baaki sab 0
â€¢ Multiple zeros â†’ saare answers 0

Prefix-suffix approach automatically handle karta hai ye cases! ðŸ‘

Off-by-One Errors in Loops

Second pass mein n-1 se 0 tak jaana hai (inclusive). range(n-1, -1, -1) use karo!

ðŸ“‹ Quick Comparison Table

Approach Time Space Notes
Brute Force O(nÂ²) O(1) TLE! Don't use
Division O(n) O(1) âŒ Not allowed!
Prefix + Suffix O(n) O(n) Easy to understand
Optimized BEST O(n) O(1) Perfect solution! âš¡
ðŸ“Œ Key insight: output[i] = (product of left) Ã— (product of right). Ye pattern bahut important hai!
ðŸ“š Problem #8

Longest Consecutive Sequence

Array mein sabse lambi consecutive sequence dhundo â€” O(n) mein! ðŸ”¢ðŸ“ˆ

ðŸŸ¡ Medium Level

Problem Kya Hai?

Ek unsorted integer array nums diya gaya hai. Tumhe longest consecutive elements sequence ki length return karni hai. Consecutive matlab 1, 2, 3, 4... ya 100, 101, 102...

Important Constraint

âš¡ Algorithm O(n) time mein run hona chahiye!
Matlab sorting allowed nahi (wo O(n log n) hai)

ðŸŽ¯ Example 1: nums = [2, 20, 4, 10, 3, 4, 5]
â†’ Consecutive sequences: [2,3,4,5], [10], [20]
â†’ Longest = [2,3,4,5] = length 4

ðŸŽ¯ Example 2: nums = [0,3,2,5,4,6,1,1]
â†’ [0,1,2,3,4,5,6] = length 7
1

Brute Force

Intuition (Sochne Ka Tarika)

Har number se start karo aur dekho kitna aage tak consecutive mil sakte hain. num+1 hai? num+2 hai? ... jab tak milte rahe, streak badhate jao!

ðŸ’­ Problem: Har number ke liye ye karte hain, toh bahut baar same sequence count hoti hai. [1,2,3,4] mein 1 se bhi count, 2 se bhi count... waste!
Python 
class Solution:
    def longestConsecutive(self, nums: List[int]) -> int:
        res = 0
        store = set(nums)  # O(1) lookup ke liye
        
        for num in nums:
            streak, curr = 0, num
            while curr in store:
                streak += 1
                curr += 1
            res = max(res, streak)
        
        return res

Time & Space Complexity

â±ï¸ Time Complexity
O(nÂ²)
Same sequences recount
ðŸ’¾ Space Complexity
O(n)
Set storage
2

Sorting Approach

Intuition (Sochne Ka Tarika)

Agar array sort kar dein, toh consecutive elements adjacent aa jayenge! Phir simply traverse karo aur streaks count karo.

ðŸ’­ [100, 4, 200, 1, 3, 2] â†’ sorted [1, 2, 3, 4, 100, 200]
Ab consecutive dhundna easy hai! Par sorting O(n log n) hai...
Python 
class Solution:
    def longestConsecutive(self, nums: List[int]) -> int:
        if not nums:
            return 0
        
        nums.sort()
        res = 1
        streak = 1
        
        for i in range(1, len(nums)):
            if nums[i] == nums[i - 1]:  # Skip duplicates
                continue
            elif nums[i] == nums[i - 1] + 1:  # Consecutive!
                streak += 1
            else:  # Sequence broken
                streak = 1
            res = max(res, streak)
        
        return res

Time & Space Complexity

â±ï¸ Time Complexity
O(n log n)
Sorting dominates
ðŸ’¾ Space Complexity
O(1)
In-place sort
ðŸ˜ Problem requirement O(n) hai, ye O(n log n) hai. Technically valid nahi!
3

Hash Set - Smart Start ðŸŽ¯

Intuition (Sochne Ka Tarika)

Key insight: Sirf sequence ke START se count karo! ðŸ’¡

Ek number sequence ka start tab hai jab num-1 set mein nahi hai!
Agar num-1 hai, toh wo number sequence ke beech mein hai, skip karo.

ðŸ’­ [1, 2, 3, 4, 100]
â€¢ 1 â†’ 0 nahi hai set mein â†’ START! Count: 1,2,3,4 = 4
â€¢ 2 â†’ 1 hai set mein â†’ skip (beech ka number hai)
â€¢ 3 â†’ 2 hai set mein â†’ skip
â€¢ 4 â†’ 3 hai set mein â†’ skip
â€¢ 100 â†’ 99 nahi hai â†’ START! Count: 100 = 1

Har number sirf ek baar process hota hai! O(n) âœ…

Algorithm (Steps)

  1. Array ko set mein convert karo (O(1) lookup)
  2. Har number ke liye check karo: num-1 set mein hai?
  3. Agar nahi hai â†’ ye sequence ka start hai!
  4. Is number se aage count karo: num+1, num+2... jab tak milte rahe
  5. Longest streak track karo
Python 
class Solution:
    def longestConsecutive(self, nums: List[int]) -> int:
        numSet = set(nums)
        longest = 0
        
        for num in numSet:
            # Only start counting from sequence START
            if (num - 1) not in numSet:
                # This is the start of a sequence!
                length = 1
                
                # Count how far the sequence goes
                while (num + length) in numSet:
                    length += 1
                
                longest = max(longest, length)
        
        return longest

Dry Run Example

nums = [100, 4, 200, 1, 3, 2]
numSet = {100, 4, 200, 1, 3, 2}

Check each number:
â€¢ 100: 99 âˆ‰ set â†’ START! count 100 â†’ length=1
â€¢ 4: 3 âˆˆ set â†’ skip (not start)
â€¢ 200: 199 âˆ‰ set â†’ START! count 200 â†’ length=1
â€¢ 1: 0 âˆ‰ set â†’ START! count 1,2,3,4 â†’ length=4 âœ…
â€¢ 3: 2 âˆˆ set â†’ skip
â€¢ 2: 1 âˆˆ set â†’ skip

Answer: 4

Kyun O(n) Hai?

ðŸ¤” "Par while loop hai andar, toh O(nÂ²) nahi hona chahiye?"

Nahi! Kyunki har number at most ek baar while loop mein process hota hai:
â€¢ While loop sirf sequence start pe chalta hai
â€¢ Har number exactly ek sequence ka part hai
â€¢ Total operations = n (har element ek baar)

Amortized O(n) hai! ðŸ˜Ž

Time & Space Complexity

â±ï¸ Time Complexity
O(n)
Each element processed once!
ðŸ’¾ Space Complexity
O(n)
Set storage
âš¡ Best approach! O(n) time meets the requirement. Interview mein ye approach expected hai!
4

Hash Map - Boundary Tracking

Intuition (Sochne Ka Tarika)

Advanced approach: Jab naya number aata hai, wo do existing sequences ko connect kar sakta hai!

Hash map mein boundary pe sequence length store karo.
â€¢ mp[num-1] = left side ki sequence length
â€¢ mp[num+1] = right side ki sequence length
Naya number dono ko join karta hai!

ðŸ’­ Jaise puzzle pieces connect karte ho â€” left piece + new piece + right piece = bigger piece! Boundaries pe length update kar do taaki future connections ke liye pata rahe.
Python 
from collections import defaultdict

class Solution:
    def longestConsecutive(self, nums: List[int]) -> int:
        mp = defaultdict(int)  # num -> sequence length at boundary
        res = 0
        
        for num in nums:
            if not mp[num]:  # Skip duplicates
                # Get lengths of adjacent sequences
                left = mp[num - 1]   # Sequence ending at num-1
                right = mp[num + 1]  # Sequence starting at num+1
                
                # New sequence length = left + current + right
                length = left + right + 1
                
                # Update current position
                mp[num] = length
                
                # Update boundaries of the merged sequence
                mp[num - left] = length   # Left boundary
                mp[num + right] = length  # Right boundary
                
                res = max(res, length)
        
        return res

Dry Run Example

nums = [1, 3, 2]

Process 1: left=0, right=0 â†’ len=1
mp = {1:1}

Process 3: left=0, right=0 â†’ len=1
mp = {1:1, 3:1}

Process 2: left=mp[1]=1, right=mp[3]=1
len = 1+1+1 = 3
Update boundaries: mp[1]=3, mp[3]=3
mp = {1:3, 2:3, 3:3}

Answer: 3 âœ…

Time & Space Complexity

â±ï¸ Time Complexity
O(n)
Single pass
ðŸ’¾ Space Complexity
O(n)
Hash map storage
ðŸ’¡ Ye approach Union-Find concept jaisi hai. Thoda complex, par interesting!
âš ï¸

Common Galtiyan (Pitfalls)

Har Number Se Sequence Start Karna

Ye biggest mistake hai! Same sequence baar baar count hoti hai â†’ O(nÂ²).

Python âŒ O(nÂ²) 
for num in nums:
    # Starts from EVERY number!
    while curr in numSet:
        ...
Python âœ… O(n) 
for num in numSet:
    if (num - 1) not in numSet:
        # Only from STARTS!
        ...

Duplicates Handle Karna

Array mein duplicates ho sakte hain jaise [1,1,2,2,3].
Set use karo â€” automatically duplicates remove ho jayenge!

Empty Array Check

Agar nums = [] hai, toh answer 0 hai. Check karo edge case!

nums vs numSet Iterate Karna

Original array pe iterate karne se duplicates baar baar process hote hain. numSet pe iterate karo!

ðŸ“‹ Quick Comparison Table

Approach Time Space Notes
Brute Force O(nÂ²) O(n) Repeated counting
Sorting O(n log n) O(1) Doesn't meet O(n) req
Hash Set BEST O(n) O(n) Start-only counting âš¡
Hash Map O(n) O(n) Boundary tracking
ðŸ“Œ Key insight: Sirf sequence ke START se count karo (num-1 should NOT exist)!
ðŸ‘‰

Two Pointers

Left-Right pointers se efficient searching aur matching

3 Problems
ðŸ“š Problem #9

Valid Palindrome

String ulta padho ya seedha â€” same hona chahiye! ðŸ”„âœ¨

ðŸŸ¢ Easy Level

Problem Kya Hai?

Ek string s diya gaya hai. Check karo ki ye palindrome hai ya nahi. Palindrome matlab jo string aage se padho ya peeche se â€” same lagti hai!

Important Rules

âš¡ Sirf alphanumeric characters (letters + digits) consider karo
âš¡ Case-insensitive comparison â€” 'A' aur 'a' same hai
âš¡ Spaces, punctuation, special characters sab ignore karo

ðŸŽ¯ Example 1: s = "A man, a plan, a canal: Panama"
â†’ Clean karo: "amanaplanacanalpanama"
â†’ Ulta: "amanaplanacanalpanama" âœ… Same! Return true

ðŸŽ¯ Example 2: s = "race a car"
â†’ Clean: "raceacar"
â†’ Ulta: "racaecar" âŒ Different! Return false

ðŸŽ¯ Example 3: s = " " (empty/space)
â†’ Clean: "" (empty string)
â†’ Empty string is palindrome! Return true
1

Reverse String Approach

Intuition (Sochne Ka Tarika)

Simple approach: Clean string banao (sirf letters+digits, lowercase), phir usko reverse karke compare karo!

ðŸ“ Step by step:
1. String mein se sirf alphanumeric characters nikalo
2. Sab lowercase mein convert karo
3. Reverse karo aur original se compare karo
Same hai? Palindrome hai! âœ…

Algorithm (Steps)

  1. Ek empty string newStr banao
  2. Har character ke liye check karo: isalnum() hai?
  3. Agar haan, toh lowercase karke newStr mein add karo
  4. newStr ko reverse karo using slicing [::-1]
  5. Compare karo: newStr == newStr[::-1]
Python 
class Solution:
    def isPalindrome(self, s: str) -> bool:
        newStr = ''
        
        for c in s:
            if c.isalnum():  # Letter ya digit hai?
                newStr += c.lower()  # Lowercase karke add
        
        return newStr == newStr[::-1]  # Reverse se compare

Python Magic: [::-1]

[::-1] Python slicing hai jo string ko reverse karta hai!
"hello"[::-1] â†’ "olleh"

Syntax: [start:end:step]
-1 step matlab ulta direction mein jao!

Time & Space Complexity

â±ï¸ Time Complexity
O(n)
String traverse + reverse
ðŸ’¾ Space Complexity
O(n)
New cleaned string
2

Two Pointers â€” In-Place âš¡

Intuition (Sochne Ka Tarika)

New string banane ki zaroorat nahi! Directly original string mein check karo.

Do pointers lo:
â€¢ l (left) â€” string ke start se
â€¢ r (right) â€” string ke end se

Dono ko andar ki taraf move karo, non-alphanumeric skip karo, aur characters compare karo!

ðŸ’¡ Jaise mirror mein dekhte ho â€” left aur right same hone chahiye!

Algorithm (Steps)

  1. Initialize: l = 0, r = len(s) - 1
  2. Jab tak l < r:
  3. l ko aage badhao jab tak alphanumeric nahi milta
  4. r ko peeche le jao jab tak alphanumeric nahi milta
  5. s[l].lower() vs s[r].lower() compare karo
  6. Match nahi? Return False
  7. Match? l++ aur r-- karo
  8. Loop complete? Return True
Python 
class Solution:
    def isPalindrome(self, s: str) -> bool:
        l, r = 0, len(s) - 1
        
        while l < r:
            # Skip non-alphanumeric from left
            while l < r and not self.alphaNum(s[l]):
                l += 1
            # Skip non-alphanumeric from right
            while r > l and not self.alphaNum(s[r]):
                r -= 1
            
            # Compare characters (case-insensitive)
            if s[l].lower() != s[r].lower():
                return False
            
            l, r = l + 1, r - 1
        
        return True
    
    def alphaNum(self, c):
        # Manual check for alphanumeric
        return (ord('A') <= ord(c) <= ord('Z') or
                ord('a') <= ord(c) <= ord('z') or
                ord('0') <= ord(c) <= ord('9'))

Alternative: Built-in isalnum()

Custom alphaNum() likhne ki jagah Python ka c.isalnum() bhi use kar sakte ho!

Par interview mein interviewer kabhi kabhi manually implement karne ko bol sakte hain â€” isliye ASCII approach jaanna zaroori hai.

Python - Cleaner Version 
class Solution:
    def isPalindrome(self, s: str) -> bool:
        l, r = 0, len(s) - 1
        
        while l < r:
            while l < r and not s[l].isalnum():
                l += 1
            while r > l and not s[r].isalnum():
                r -= 1
            
            if s[l].lower() != s[r].lower():
                return False
            
            l += 1
            r -= 1
        
        return True

Dry Run Example

s = "A man, a plan, a canal: Panama"

Initial: l=0 ('A'), r=29 ('a')
â€¢ 'A'.lower() == 'a'.lower() âœ… â†’ l=1, r=28

Step 2: l=1 (' '), r=28 ('m')
â€¢ Skip space â†’ l=2 ('m')
â€¢ 'm' == 'm' âœ… â†’ l=3, r=27

... continue until l >= r ...

All match! Return True âœ…

Time & Space Complexity

â±ï¸ Time Complexity
O(n)
Single pass with two pointers
ðŸ’¾ Space Complexity
O(1)
No extra string created! ðŸŽ‰
âš¡ Best approach! Same time complexity par O(1) space â€” no extra memory needed!
âš ï¸

Common Galtiyan (Pitfalls)

Non-Alphanumeric Characters Skip Nahi Karna

Spaces, commas, colons sab ignore karne hain! "A man, a plan" mein spaces aur comma compare mat karo.

Python âŒ Wrong 
for i in range(len(s)//2):
    if s[i] != s[-(i+1)]:
        return False
# Spaces bhi compare ho jayenge!
Python âœ… Correct 
while l < r and not s[l].isalnum():
    l += 1  # Skip non-alpha
# Sirf valid chars compare honge

Case Sensitivity Bhool Jana

'A' aur 'a' same treat karne hain! Direct compare kiya toh false milega.

Python âŒ Wrong 
if s[l] != s[r]:  # 'A' != 'a'
    return False
Python âœ… Correct 
if s[l].lower() != s[r].lower():
    return False

Pointer Bounds Check Bhool Jana

Inner while loops mein bhi l < r check karna zaroori hai! Warna pointers cross ho sakte hain.

ðŸ“‹ Quick Comparison Table

Approach Time Space Notes
Reverse String O(n) O(n) Simple, extra string needed
Two Pointers BEST O(n) O(1) In-place, no extra space! âš¡
ðŸ“Œ Key insight: Two pointers se extra space avoid karo. Non-alphanumeric skip karo, lowercase mein compare karo!
ðŸ“š Problem #10

3Sum

Teen numbers dhundo jinke sum = 0 ho â€” duplicates bina! ðŸŽ¯ðŸ”¢

ðŸŸ¡ Medium Level

Problem Kya Hai?

Ek integer array nums diya gaya hai. Tumhe saare unique triplets [nums[i], nums[j], nums[k]] dhundne hain jahan i â‰  j â‰  k aur nums[i] + nums[j] + nums[k] == 0.

Important Points

âš¡ Triplets unique hone chahiye â€” same elements wale duplicate triplets mat do
âš¡ Answer mein triplets kisi bhi order mein ho sakte hain
âš¡ Triplet ke andar elements bhi kisi bhi order mein ho sakte hain

ðŸŽ¯ Example 1: nums = [-1, 0, 1, 2, -1, -4]
â†’ Triplets: [-1, 0, 1], [-1, 2, -1] = [[-1,-1,2], [-1,0,1]]
Note: [-1,0,1] aur [0,1,-1] same triplet hai!

ðŸŽ¯ Example 2: nums = [0, 1, 1]
â†’ Koi triplet nahi jo sum = 0 de â†’ []

ðŸŽ¯ Example 3: nums = [0, 0, 0]
â†’ [[0, 0, 0]] â€” sirf ek unique triplet
1

Brute Force

Intuition (Sochne Ka Tarika)

Simple approach: Har possible triplet try karo! Teen nested loops use karke (i, j, k) combinations check karo jahan i < j < k.

ðŸ’­ Sorting se duplicates handle karna easy ho jata hai â€” set mein store karke unique rakho!

Algorithm (Steps)

  1. Array sort karo
  2. Empty set res banao unique triplets ke liye
  3. Three nested loops chalo: i, j > i, k > j
  4. Check karo: nums[i] + nums[j] + nums[k] == 0?
  5. Haan toh triplet set mein add karo
  6. Set ko list mein convert karke return karo
Python 
class Solution:
    def threeSum(self, nums: List[int]) -> List[List[int]]:
        res = set()
        nums.sort()
        
        for i in range(len(nums)):
            for j in range(i + 1, len(nums)):
                for k in range(j + 1, len(nums)):
                    if nums[i] + nums[j] + nums[k] == 0:
                        tmp = [nums[i], nums[j], nums[k]]
                        res.add(tuple(tmp))
        
        return [list(i) for i in res]

Time & Space Complexity

â±ï¸ Time Complexity
O(nÂ³)
Three nested loops
ðŸ’¾ Space Complexity
O(m)
m = number of triplets
ðŸ˜ Bahut slow hai! TLE (Time Limit Exceeded) hoga large inputs pe.
2

Hash Map Approach

Intuition (Sochne Ka Tarika)

Sorting ke baad do numbers fix karo, aur third number hash map se dhundo! Third number = -(nums[i] + nums[j])

Frequency map use karo taaki same element multiple times use na ho jaye. Jab first/second element pick karo, temporarily unki count decrease karo.

ðŸ’¡ Two Sum jaisa concept hai â€” par yahan teen elements chahiye!
Python 
from collections import defaultdict

class Solution:
    def threeSum(self, nums: List[int]) -> List[List[int]]:
        nums.sort()
        count = defaultdict(int)
        for num in nums:
            count[num] += 1
        
        res = []
        for i in range(len(nums)):
            count[nums[i]] -= 1  # Use kar liya
            if i and nums[i] == nums[i - 1]:  # Skip duplicate
                continue
            
            for j in range(i + 1, len(nums)):
                count[nums[j]] -= 1  # Use kar liya
                if j - 1 > i and nums[j] == nums[j - 1]:  # Skip dup
                    continue
                
                target = -(nums[i] + nums[j])
                if count[target] > 0:  # Third number available?
                    res.append([nums[i], nums[j], target])
            
            # Restore counts for next iteration
            for j in range(i + 1, len(nums)):
                count[nums[j]] += 1
        
        return res

Time & Space Complexity

â±ï¸ Time Complexity
O(nÂ²)
Two loops + O(1) lookup
ðŸ’¾ Space Complexity
O(n)
Hash map storage
3

Two Pointers â€” Optimal ðŸŽ¯

Intuition (Sochne Ka Tarika)

Sorting + Two Pointers = Magic! âœ¨

Pehle array sort karo. Phir ek element fix karo (a), aur baaki do elements ke liye two pointer technique use karo!

ðŸ’¡ Sorting se do fayde:
1. Duplicates skip karna easy
2. Left/Right pointer move karne se sum predictably badhta/ghatta hai

Algorithm (Steps)

  1. Array sort karo
  2. Har index i ke liye, a = nums[i] fix karo
  3. Agar a > 0, break (sab positive hain, sum 0 nahi ho sakta)
  4. Duplicate a skip karo (agar nums[i] == nums[i-1])
  5. Two pointers set karo: l = i+1, r = end
  6. Jab tak l < r:
    • threeSum = a + nums[l] + nums[r]
    • Sum > 0? r-- (sum chhota karo)
    • Sum < 0? l++ (sum bada karo)
    • Sum == 0? Triplet found! ðŸŽ‰
  7. Triplet milne ke baad, duplicate l skip karo
Python 
class Solution:
    def threeSum(self, nums: List[int]) -> List[List[int]]:
        res = []
        nums.sort()
        
        for i, a in enumerate(nums):
            # Early termination: if a > 0, no way to get sum = 0
            if a > 0:
                break
            
            # Skip duplicate values for first element
            if i > 0 and a == nums[i - 1]:
                continue
            
            # Two pointers for remaining two elements
            l, r = i + 1, len(nums) - 1
            
            while l < r:
                threeSum = a + nums[l] + nums[r]
                
                if threeSum > 0:
                    r -= 1  # Sum too big, decrease
                elif threeSum < 0:
                    l += 1  # Sum too small, increase
                else:
                    # Found a valid triplet!
                    res.append([a, nums[l], nums[r]])
                    l += 1
                    r -= 1
                    
                    # Skip duplicates for left pointer
                    while nums[l] == nums[l - 1] and l < r:
                        l += 1
        
        return res

Dry Run Example

nums = [-1, 0, 1, 2, -1, -4]
sorted = [-4, -1, -1, 0, 1, 2]

i=0, a=-4:
l=1(-1), r=5(2): sum = -4+(-1)+2 = -3 < 0 â†’ l++
l=2(-1), r=5(2): sum = -4+(-1)+2 = -3 < 0 â†’ l++
l=3(0), r=5(2): sum = -4+0+2 = -2 < 0 â†’ l++
l=4(1), r=5(2): sum = -4+1+2 = -1 < 0 â†’ l++
l=5 >= r â†’ done

i=1, a=-1:
l=2(-1), r=5(2): sum = -1+(-1)+2 = 0 âœ… [-1,-1,2]
l=3, r=4
l=3(0), r=4(1): sum = -1+0+1 = 0 âœ… [-1,0,1]
l=4 >= r â†’ done

i=2, a=-1: Skip! (same as nums[1])

i=3, a=0:
l=4(1), r=5(2): sum = 0+1+2 = 3 > 0 â†’ r--
l=4 >= r â†’ done

i=4, a=1 > 0: Break!

Result: [[-1,-1,2], [-1,0,1]] âœ…

Kyun Kaam Karta Hai?

Sorted array pe two pointers kyun work karte hain?

â€¢ Agar sum > target: r-- karo (bada number chhota karo)
â€¢ Agar sum < target: l++ karo (chhota number bada karo)
â€¢ Sum == target: Found! ðŸŽ‰

Har step mein search space shrink hota hai â€” koi valid pair miss nahi hota!

Time & Space Complexity

â±ï¸ Time Complexity
O(nÂ²)
Outer loop + two pointers
ðŸ’¾ Space Complexity
O(1)*
*excluding output
âš¡ Best approach! O(nÂ²) time aur O(1) extra space (sorting ke alawa). Interview mein ye expected hai!
âš ï¸

Common Galtiyan (Pitfalls)

Duplicates Skip Nahi Karna

Biggest mistake! Duplicate triplets result mein aa jayenge. [-1, -1, 0, 1, 1] pe wrong answer aayega.

Python âŒ Wrong 
for i, a in enumerate(nums):
    # No duplicate check!
    l, r = i + 1, len(nums) - 1
Python âœ… Correct 
for i, a in enumerate(nums):
    if i > 0 and a == nums[i-1]:
        continue  # Skip duplicate!

Sorting Bhool Jana

Two pointer technique sirf sorted array pe kaam karti hai! Bina sort ke pointers move karne ka logic fail ho jayega.

Wrong Early Termination

a >= 0 pe break karna galat hai! [0,0,0] miss ho jayega.

Python âŒ Wrong 
if a >= 0:  # Misses [0,0,0]!
    break
Python âœ… Correct 
if a > 0:  # Only positive!
    break

Left Pointer Duplicate Skip Bhool Jana

Triplet milne ke baad sirf l++ nahi, duplicate l bhi skip karo! Warna same triplet phir se add ho jayega.

ðŸ“‹ Quick Comparison Table

Approach Time Space Notes
Brute Force O(nÂ³) O(m) TLE on large inputs
Hash Map O(nÂ²) O(n) Extra space for map
Two Pointers BEST O(nÂ²) O(1)* Sort + two pointers âš¡
ðŸ“Œ Key insight: Sort karo, ek element fix karo, baaki do ke liye two pointers use karo. Duplicates skip karna mat bhoolna!
ðŸ“š Problem #11

Container With Most Water

Do lines ke beech maximum water store karna hai â€” Two Pointers ka classic use! ðŸŒŠ

ðŸŸ¡ Medium Level

Problem Kya Hai?

Ek array heights diya gaya hai jahan heights[i] ek vertical line ki height hai position i pe. Tumhe do lines choose karni hain jo X-axis ke saath milke ek container banaye â€” aur us container mein maximum kitna water aa sakta hai woh batana hai.

ðŸŽ¯ Visualize karo: Do walls hain, unke beech paani bharoge. Height chhoti wall se limited hai, width = distance between walls.
ðŸŽ¯ Formula: Area = min(height[left], height[right]) Ã— (right - left)

Example:

heights = [1, 8, 6, 2, 5, 4, 8, 3, 7]

Output: 49

Explanation: Index 1 (height=8) aur Index 8 (height=7) choose karo â†’ min(8,7) Ã— (8-1) = 7 Ã— 7 = 49

ðŸŽ¨ Visual Representation

heights = [1, 8, 6, 2, 5, 4, 8, 3, 7]

        |              |        
        |              |     |  
        |  |           |     |  
        |  |     |     |     |  
        |  |     |  |  |     |  
        |  |     |  |  |  |  |  
        |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  
     |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  
     â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€
     0  1  2  3  4  5  6  7  8
         â†‘                    â†‘
        left                right
        
     Container: min(8,7) Ã— (8-1) = 7 Ã— 7 = 49 ðŸ’§
1

Brute Force Approach

Intuition (Sochne Ka Tarika)

Sabse seedha tarika â€” har possible pair try karo! ðŸ”

Do nested loops chalao: pehla loop left wall choose karega, doosra loop right wall. Har pair ke liye area calculate karo aur maximum track karo.

ðŸ’­ Jaise 10 logo mein se do log choose karke unke beech distance measure kar rahe ho â€” har combination check karo!

Algorithm Steps

1
Initialize: maxArea = 0 â€” maximum area track karne ke liye
2
Outer Loop: i = 0 to n-1 â€” left wall choose karo
3
Inner Loop: j = i+1 to n-1 â€” right wall choose karo
4
Calculate Area: height = min(heights[i], heights[j]), width = j - i
5
Update Max: maxArea = max(maxArea, height Ã— width)

Python Code

def maxArea(heights):
    res = 0
    n = len(heights)
    
    # Har pair try karo
    for i in range(n):
        for j in range(i + 1, n):
            # Height = chhoti wall, Width = distance
            height = min(heights[i], heights[j])
            width = j - i
            area = height * width
            res = max(res, area)
    
    return res

# Example
heights = [1, 8, 6, 2, 5, 4, 8, 3, 7]
print(maxArea(heights))  # Output: 49

Dry Run

Input: heights = [1, 8, 6, 2, 5, 4, 8, 3, 7]

ijheights[i]heights[j]minwidthareamaxArea
01181111
08171888
1688854040
1887774949 âœ…

Final Answer: 49

â±ï¸ Time: O(nÂ²)
ðŸ’¾ Space: O(1)
2

Two Pointers Approach âœ¨ OPTIMAL

Intuition (Sochne Ka Tarika)

Yeh greedy + two pointers ka brilliant use hai! ðŸ’¡

Key Insight: Sabse wide container se shuru karo (left at start, right at end). Ab area badhane ke liye kya kar sakte hain?

  • Area = height Ã— width
  • Width toh hamesha kam hogi jab pointers move karenge (inside jaayenge)
  • Toh area badhane ka ek hi chance hai â€” height badhao!
  • Height chhoti wall se limited hai
  • Toh chhoti wall wala pointer move karo â€” shayad badi wall mile! ðŸŽ¯
ðŸ’­ Kyun kaam karta hai? Agar badi wall move karoge toh:
- Height same ya kam rahegi (chhoti wall ab bhi limit kar rahi hai)
- Width kam ho gayi
- Area DEFINITELY kam hoga! âŒ

Toh chhoti wall move karna hi sahi hai â€” at least chance hai ki badi wall mile! âœ…

Algorithm Steps

1
Initialize Pointers: left = 0, right = n - 1 (sabse wide)
2
Initialize Result: maxArea = 0
3
While left < right:
  • Calculate current area
  • Update maxArea if current is larger
  • Move the pointer with smaller height
4
Return: maxArea

Python Code

def maxArea(heights):
    left = 0
    right = len(heights) - 1
    maxArea = 0
    
    while left < right:
        # Current container ka area
        height = min(heights[left], heights[right])
        width = right - left
        area = height * width
        
        # Maximum update karo
        maxArea = max(maxArea, area)
        
        # IMPORTANT: Chhoti wall wala pointer move karo
        if heights[left] <= heights[right]:
            left += 1   # Left chhota hai, toh right jaao
        else:
            right -= 1  # Right chhota hai, toh left jaao
    
    return maxArea

# Example
heights = [1, 8, 6, 2, 5, 4, 8, 3, 7]
print(maxArea(heights))  # Output: 49

Detailed Dry Run

Input: heights = [1, 8, 6, 2, 5, 4, 8, 3, 7]

Stepleftrighth[L]h[R]minwidthareamaxAreaMove
108171888L++ (1<7)
21887774949 â­R-- (8>7)
31783361849R-- (8>3)
41688854049L++ (8â‰¤8)
52668642449L++ (6<8)
6362823649L++ (2<8)
74658521049L++ (5<8)
8564841449L++ (4<8)

When left=6, right=6 â†’ Loop ends. Answer: 49 âœ…

â±ï¸ Time: O(n)
ðŸ’¾ Space: O(1)

âš ï¸ Common Galtiyan (Pitfalls)

âŒ

Wrong Pointer Move Karna

Badi wall wala pointer move karna GALAT hai! Height same rahegi, width kam hogi = area definitely kam!

âœ… Fix: Hamesha chhoti height wala pointer move karo
âŒ

Trapping Rain Water Samajhna

Yeh problem "Trapping Rain Water" se DIFFERENT hai! Wahan multiple bars ke beech water sum karna hota hai, yahan sirf DO lines se ek container.

âœ… Fix: Yahan sirf 2 walls choose karni hain, beech ke bars matter nahi karte!
âŒ

Width Calculation Galat

width = right - left hai, NOT right - left + 1! Yeh off-by-one error bahut common hai.

âœ… Fix: Index 1 aur 8 ke beech distance = 8 - 1 = 7 units

ðŸ“‹ Quick Comparison Table

Approach Time Space Notes
Brute Force O(nÂ²) O(1) Har pair check â€” TLE on large inputs
Two Pointers BEST O(n) O(1) Greedy â€” chhoti wall move karo âš¡
ðŸ“Œ Key Insight: Wide se shuru karo, chhoti wall move karo. Area = min(heights) Ã— width. Badi wall move karna kabhi faydemand nahi! ðŸŒŠ
ðŸ–¥ï¸

Sliding Window
